messages.title: What's at Stake in Congleton Constituency at this Election?
messages.content: Real progress has been made in Congleton, and working together, I still want to do more to enable me to build on this record of action, support Fiona Bruce on 12 December.

messages.title: Dear Resident
messages.content: It has been a privilege and an honour to serve this Constituency for almost ten years and I want to thank you for putting your trust in me and for the generosity of community spirit that is so evident here. This makes a real difference to the lives of local people in so many ways. If elected again as your MP, I am determined to continue to work with residents to make a positive difference. I am also determined to continue to debate politics with courtesy and kindness. Alienating others in this way risks inhibiting progress, whilst some of the most effective work I have been privileged to be engaged in has been cross-party, such as tackling human trafficking, addressing environmental concerns, promoting human rights, tackling addiction, and strengthening family life. I believe politicians serve people best when they resist engaging in personal insults and commit to civility in our political discourse.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Supporting better funding for our schools
keyPolicies.policyDescription: I will continue to prioritise this issue. Education Minister Nick Gibb said 'If you tribute to my hon. Friend, it was as a result of her intervention that we introduced minimum per pupil funding.'

I have worked hard to secure millions in Government funding for Congleton Link Road, Middlewich Bypass and pothole repairs. I am strongly supporting residents to improve rail services and reopen Middlewich Railway Station.
A key part of an MP's role should be to support local businesses, so I regularly visit them to hear about their concerns and help troubleshoot problems such as better broadband.
I was an early supporter of the call for a Government commitment to a Net Zero emissions target; I am committed to plastic use reduction, cleaner air, and to protecting local green spaces.

I have campaigned for more funding for GP services, better provision for mental health services and new roles to help people closer to their homes. I will continue to support residents' needs for health & social care, and to help support A&E services.
It's been a privilege for almost ten years to work with schools, churches & community groups, with projects such as the Alsager Sports Hub - which it was my privilege to open this Autumn!
